dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A playground at night, completely empty. One of the swing drifts back and forth . . . The back door to a home is open. A piece of light cuts ac the porch from inside . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the back stairwell another door is open, leading into apartment . . . Down the hall, a third door opens to reveal a small, spar bedroom. A small mattress on the floor holds a dirty-face little girl asleep under her blanket . . . Footsteps heard, quietly moving through the house . . . A three foot gate hangs open. A car starts and pulls away We begin to hear the voice of Jack Doyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda McCready was taken from her home sometime between eight and eight thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK DOYLE (60s) speaks at a press conference on a small, PORTABLE TELEVISION with a 3x4 inch screen resting on the dashboard of a car and plugged into the lighter outlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is four years old, has blond hair and green eyes, 35 pounds and about 3 and a half feet tall. Amanda's mother says she put her to bed in her B e a u t y and t h e B e a s t nightgown . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick Kenzie and Angela Gennaro sit in the car watching idly. TV: A clip from an interview with Amanda's mother, HELENE MCCREADY (29-39). She looks haggard and in desperate need sleep, if not a stint in detox. Standing beside her is he brother LIONEL and sister-in-law BEATRICE, both of whom w will come to know later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is she just always had a smile on her face, you know? That was her. She was always smilin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, who would take my little girl? What did she ever do to anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaguely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you're channel nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Timmy Reilly. Is he a cop now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A press conference with JACK DOYLE (68) comes on. Beneath image is written "JACK DOYLE, CRIMES AGAINST CHILDREN."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the pain of losing a daughter --We will pursue every avenue--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't be taking that many avenues. The whole force is outside the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are parked on a street in Dorchester lined with residential apartments and storefronts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK on the windowsill startles them both. It's A NEIGHBORHOOD GUY, BOBBY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winks, being funny ) Hey. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, Bobby. Nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby moves on down the street. She looks at Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why it's embarrassing to do surveillance three blocks from where we live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over Patrick and through the windshield we see A MAN AND WOMAN emerge from a MINT GREEN 3-DECKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss before parting ways. The MAN hops into a GREEN LINCOLN while the WOMAN heads down the block, on foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They' re splitting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with him. I'll follow the mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie jumps out and starts following the woman. Patrick p slowly from the curb and trails the Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. PATRICK   &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick turns a corner on a residential street. Then anot one, keeping about a block between himself and the Lincol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, A TEN YEAR OLD KID darts in front of Patrick at BMX bicycle. Patrick has to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move the Huffy before I slap your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick waits for the kid to move. As he drives by he rea out to CUFF the kid, who eludes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missed me, faggot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick pulls out onto Dot Ave. He looks around, doesn't the Lincoln. He goes left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick drives a few cars behind the Lincoln. He can't ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car STOPS in front of Patrick. He tries to go around, traffic is oncoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car moves. The Lincoln is long gone. He pulls the car over. He sees an ITALIAN MAN IN HIS SIXTIES looking at him from sidewalk (GERRY SPECA). The man sits in front of a VFW. T trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick dials his phone and puts it to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine one one, what's your emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to report a drunk driver. I saw him consuming alcohol in his front seat, and he almost swiped an old lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the description?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at paper) 1989 Green Lincoln Mercury LS. Massachusetts Patriots bonus edition license plate 357 bravo. 929.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. God bless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick reaches into the glove compartment and produces a small device. He turns it on and sets it on the dash. By SCRATCHY VOICES and STACCATO CODE we realize it's a POLIC SCANNER. He waits. Cars roll by. Wipe. Shot outside car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick is in the car. Listening. His phone rings. He answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dot Ave, where a r e you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nguyen' s n a i l s a l o n .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T h a t ' s where s h e went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. I ' m g e t t i n g my n a i l s d o n e . You s t i with t h e father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I l o s t him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You d i d ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L i n c o l n Mercury Cougar, n i n e t y e i g h t . Broadway and L S t . F i e l d S o b r i e t y . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops, t h e r e h e i s .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And h e p u l l s o u t .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On t h e s i d e o f t h e r o a d , s e v e r a l OFFICE SOBRIETY TEST t o t h e MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man i s u p s e t . He g e s t u r e s a t t h e P o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P a t r i c k p u l l s up a c r o s s t h e s t r e e t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They l e t t h e man g o .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P a t r i c k e a s e s o u t a f t e r him. He W V S t o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: b a c k , n o t knowing him o r why h e i s waving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From P a t r i c k ' s c a r , we s e e t h e F a t h e r head i n t h e door, h o l d i n g h i s b a d .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P a t r i c k w a t c h e s from a c r o s s t h e s t r He sees all the sweet-faced little kids, all dressed up i the best clothes their parents could afford, running and shrieking and playing kick-ball in a tiny play lot inside giant, ramshackle housing project. The father emerges, BAGLESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Patrick walks past we dolly low alongside him and onto playground. He approaches the door the father came out of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick comes in. There are a bunch of the ubiquitous MIS CHILDREN FLIERS on the ground. A door to a unit is ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick eases the door open a bit. Patrick goes to his haunches so as to stay out of sight at the opening. Throu the crack we see a man and a woman arguing. A woman MAUREEN, Irish (34) is making breakfast. She call out to the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want them eggs runnin' ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY MEADE rolls into frame, bitching about his conditio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah. Where'd my father leave the bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She indicates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Cheryl Martin said Donna hired missing persons investigators to find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not missin'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' bullshit. I can't go back to my own home to get my own clothes for fear of gettin' my wages garnished to support Mike Cuddehy' s fuckin' kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick looks at the floor, the BAG the Father was carryi has CLOTHES in it. The KID comes to the opening in the door. He looks at Patrick. Patrick holds a finger to his lips: shhh.

dialogues.speaker: EXT TAFT ST.
dialogues.text: Patrick parks and walks by various families.

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: Patrick looks at a paper. It's their ad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dorchester' s best missing persons?" That's terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like having world's tallest midget as your slogan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better than the old one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just saying that cause the new one has your name on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick takes his gun out, wallet, puts them on the table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a certain point the person who books half the business is entitled to her name on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of which, how'd you get Tommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people need to learn how to hide better. Staying at your girlfriend's in OC projects ain't slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the reason you book half the business is cause no one's trying to get in my trousers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep telling yourself that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long, intimate improvised scene in their bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick walks down the hallway toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, you want some cereal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes cereal.   Walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick walks by the door. He pushes on it. She BUMPS it shut. He stands there for a minute, thinks of an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to see if you wanted some food .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick comes into the living room, the television is on. puts the cereal down and starts eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK DOYLE (60s) speaks at a press conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is four years old, has blond hair and green eyes, 35 pounds and about 3 and a half feet tall. Amanda's mother says she put her to bed in her B e a u t y a n d t h e B e a s t nightgown . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick watches. TV: A clip from an interview with Amanda's mother, HELENE MCCREADY (29-39).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is she just always had a smile on her face, you know? That was her. She was always smilin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, who would take my little girl? What did she ever do to anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaguely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you're Channel Nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down to watch. A press conference with JACK DOYLE (68) comes on. Beneath his image is written "JACK DOYLE, CRIMES AGAINST CHILDREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will pursue every avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't be taking that many avenues. The whole force is outside the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV: A STILL PHOTO OF AMANDA MCCREADY (4) occupies a corne the frame. She has dirty blonde hair and a shy smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mother says Amanda may be carrying Mirabelle, her favorite doll . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On TV the camera goes to BEA and LIONEL.   Bea Speaks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever you are, if you have her, just give her back. We won't charge you. If you're out there, just let her go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these guys. Standing around posing for the camera like they have a purpose. That's why cops hate us. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause they know we do the same thing as them without five years of jungle gym Police academy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. PATRICK   &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick is standing in the doorway, looking at Beatrice a Lionel McCready, not entirely sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My niece is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a hand picking clothes up off the couch in their 'officer-- which is basically their living room. Now we get a good look at their guests, who are standing politely. BEA MCCREADY (mid 50s, matronly) we recognize from the TV clip. She has a kind patience that has been tried by her ordeal. Her husband, LIONEL (mid 40s)' we remember as well. Lione is the kind of man who was once a hard drinker, a fighter a troublemaker. Now 'recovered,' he has been a husband, provider and peacemaker for almost twenty years. Angie is also trying to tidy the detritus of their mornin which lie strewn around their office, including a bra whi is behind the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard about that on the news . . .Excuse the mess. We just finished another case. . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry, Mrs. McCready. I can't imagine what this time must be like for your family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my associate, Angela Gennaro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all four stand there, not sure what comes next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to hire you to augment the police with the investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one says anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Jean Benet Ramsey. The family hired investigators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police are nowhere, they're slow, they keep us in the dark. We want our own investigators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure we're who you're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that what you do? The ad in the paper said 'missing persons.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiniest of looks from Patrick to Angie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Angie is trying to say is: we usually get hired to find people who like, take off to New Hampshire without payin' for their jet ski--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bea looks up at Patrick, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every Police officer in Boston is looking for your niece. This is something they're qualified for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure how much help we can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear her out, Ange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna do any harm, are you? ( shaking her head) Why is this so hard? The cops sent one man until I called the Herald and raised Cain. The cops don't want me hirin' you. Now you don't want the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that we don't want the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know people in the neighborhood? People who don't want to talk to Police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. We do. Have the Police told you anything so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I hear they have "no leads" one more time I'm gonna lose my marbles. I mean, Helene was watching TV next door and wasn't gone for more than a half hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was watching "Wife Swap" downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her favorite show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beatrice snorts. Lionel shoots her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Germany. Army base. He doesn't want nothin' to do with Helene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Amanda. He doesn't think she's his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anyone you know? An acquaintance who could have taken her . . . a neighbor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You think she was definitely taken though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she were lost I think they . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bea may be coming unglued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't she have fallen down a well or something? Like in Texas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what we hope for.. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is Helene holding up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Lionel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it. I had my problems, hard bust at 22. Bea straightened me out. Helene hasn't had that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she has you. You find her work-- she was our housekeeper for a year and a half-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, come talk to Helene yourself. I don't care if you think you can help. Try. There must be something you can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at them expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll meet you over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws Angie another small look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a lot of money, but I saved over the years. Don't think we can't afford it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie gives her a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. PATRICK   &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Angie are in their car. They pull to a stop, looking at something off-camera right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If a missing child isn't found in seventy two hours they are almost never recovered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty quick with the facts for someone who's so unqualified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read that on the computer in two minutes while you were getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that, you're already on the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We aren't needed, we canrt make a difference and we can't take their money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to take their money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to find a child in a dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I. I want to find one alive who we can bring home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a good life, Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This won't change that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go out in the rain, you get wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's a four year-old girl out there, you go out and bring her back. We'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We might recognize it from the nighttime abduction sequen except that now it's swarming with: CAMERA TRUCKS, MEDIA TYPES and LOOKEY-LOOS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a big shot full of REPORTERS, LOCALS, KIDS, A GUY WITH A GRILL, AN ICE-CREAM TRUCK. People mill around and converse. KIDS wave behind REPORTE heads, trying to get on camera. We carry Patrick and Angie through with a Steadi-Cam as t react to the circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIELD REPORTER does a stand-up, dressed formally to the waist in a sports coat and tie but wears shorts below. He heavy pancake make-up on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Block party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the front porch. One, OFFICER REILLY (from TV) stops Patrick as he comes i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends of the family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timrny. It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel is out on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick heads down the hall toward the kitchen but turns when he sees Angie going into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Angie enter the small two bedroom apartment. is crowded and crawling with police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELENE MCCREADY (in rough shape) sits wearing a "born to shop" T-shirt. Her best friend DOTTIE sits next to her. T are engrossed in a DAY-TIME TALK SHOW. Dottie wears a "Do Rat" T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helene, this is Patrick Kenzie and Angela Gennaro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women on the couch look over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie looks blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRM high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie offers a fake smile, half-recognition, polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you're still conceited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you excuse us, Dottie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dottie's my best friend, Lionel. She can be in my house if she wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just want to ask a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can be here for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now everyone wants to be part of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already talked to the cops forty times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sorry to take up your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beatrice asked us to come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - W h y don't Bea mind her business. It's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause everyone's tryin' to get their moment now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bea hired these people to help find Amanda with her own money. You better show them the God damn courtesy they deserve !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in grief, prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can grieve how she wants, Dottie. You don't live here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't yell at her. You ain't her father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Lionel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel marches over toward Dottie. She scoots in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dottie storms from the room. Patrick and Angie stand uncomfortably in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry . . . I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I speak with you for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you excuse us, Helene?

dialogues.text: From behind, we see her lift her shirt, exposing her bra. Cheese seems satisfied.

dialogues.text: He takes another whack at the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know one "McCready." Kept a bitch in my stable by that name. No titties, fucked up shit goin' on with the face-- But you give her the right shit she get freaky. Bounce up and down on yo shit. Pop! Pop! Go t h e w e a s e l .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes back for the pipe, seems to lose his concentratio Patrick unsnaps his holster, subtly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you point a gun at her again I'm gonna pull your fuckin' card, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You' re saying you didn't do it? Okay. What other choice do I have? We'll take your money and go along our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But If I find out you' re lying, I'll spend every nickel of your money dedicated to fuckin' you up. I'll bribe cops to go after you, I'll pays guys to go after your crew, I'll tell everyone I know that you're a C.I. and a rat -- and I know a lot of people. Cheese. After that, you're gonna wished you had listened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause your shitty pool-hall crime syndicate headquarters will be raided, your doped up bitches will get sent back to Laos and this dumb mutherfucker

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: will be testifying against you for a reduced sentence while you end up in a cell with a big motherfucker, his dick and your Zippo 'cause from what I heard, guys who kill kids aren't treated too good in Concord. But maybe I'm wrong. Maybe things are different these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't never speak to me that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't shit. Yo bitch ain't shit. Neither one of y'all motherfuckers is shit. Fuck both ya' 11. If you didn't have two pig out in my meadow--! put a round in both your heads right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheese's eyes narrow, his pupils like black pinpricks in irises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if that girl only hope is you. I pray for her. She is gone, baby. Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out. And if I see you on the street, I'm a get discourteous on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And get this sausage off my lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates Poole and Bressant who can be see through th window, smoking on a small patch of dirt outside the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Anqie approach Poole and Bressant. Patrick sh his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he didn't know anything but if we had his money we could leave it in the mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what he told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said nothing else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants you off his fuckin' lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you knew the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half the guys he grew up with are degenerates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what the other half are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops. But don't hold it against me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. You know what I hold against you? We had one chance to make this deal. You said you knew him, you said you could do it and you fucked it up. Now we have to get a warrant for a tap, start surveillance and hope to Christ we get lucky. If that costs Amanda her life, I won't have to hold it against you. You'll hold it against yourself for a good, long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT PATRICK   &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Angie in their bedroom. It's late and they ca sleep. A LOCAL NEWS REPEAT runs on the television woven i their dialogue. In effect, it will play like background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the Police taking over isn't necessarily a bad thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see more child exploitation in a week than we could in a career...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes you want to have kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets Angle's attention. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it make you not want to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick drinks his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a political party in Holland that openly advocates pedophelia and won seats in parliament. In America four hundred thousand kids get abused every year. There are half a million convicted, registered sex offenders, two-thirds of them for molesting children under fourteen, there are a hundred thousand child porn web sites. They busted one in texas had seventy thousand members-- people who gave their credit cards . . . There's a group, the 'Rene Guyon' society, whose motto is 'sex before eight or it's too late.' There's a rise in the victimization of 'pre-verbal' children, for the obvious reason that they can't report their accusers. One in five American girls is sexually abused or victimized before they turn eighteen. But only one third of those every tells anyone in their lifetime that they were abused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a look: 'oh, really?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read that in two minutes on the computer while you were taking a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that tells you you don't want children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It tells me there aren't enough gas chambers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I' d love to have a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just not sure a kid would love to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be the guy who fucked this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick is asleep. Angle is on the far side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you did something right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheese came around. Called in and said he wants to make a drop. Said he left something in your mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're gonna have to check the mailbox yourself, but yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is and it isn't. They tape calls coming into the station now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means Jack heard about it, he wants you down here and he's fuckin' pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. PATRICK    &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk out the front door and, sure enough, there is a ENVELOPE in the mailbox. But what gets their attention is that jammed into the box, along with the letter is AMANDA BLANKET. Patrick takes it out, hands it to Angie. They react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Angie follow Devin down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the boss wants you met, he only sends the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or when he wants you brought up the back way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devin smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through an area with cells in it that looks medieval. They move through another door into a small con room. Then they walk into a lobby. He comes to a stop at Doyle's SECRETARY'S DESK. His SECRETARY, RENE ( 3 0 , attractive) seems to know Dev

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Doyle's ofice) He in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah he said just let 'em in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer.      Devin turns to Patrick and Angie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts back.   They turn to the door and ENTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Angie fail at entering unobtrusively. Poole a Bressant are being lectured by Captain Jack Doyle. Doyle turns his attention (for the first time) to Patrick Angie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Patrick and Angie) You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle picks up a paper TRANSCRIPT and hands it to Patrick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the transcript of a call that was recorded coming into the station this morning. Care to read the highlighted portion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caller: Bitch you better have my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick looks up.    The room is quite.   He continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Bressant: Who is this? Caller: You know who the fuck this is, fool (Creole curse words)- If you want that girl back you need to meet me up Quincy tonight. Fuck around for a minute and I throw that girl in the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "lake" he refers to is the water in the abandoned quarry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He refers to the transcript.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Bressant goes on to make an unauthorized ransom arrangement to exchange Amanda McCready for a hundred and thirty thousand dollars, tonight in just that location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of quiet. Doyle gestures toward Bressant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After some discussion, Detective Bressant was kind enough to produce this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates the bag of money on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look familiar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Angle offer a guilty plea by their silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing as you two made the initial

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, we were concerned for the safety

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand what your concern was. My concern, interestingly, is also for the well being of that child. And now that concern has been elevated because of the risky and ill-advised course of action you people have taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four of you have made me party to an illegal activity without my knowledge or consent and I don't fucking appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be party to it, sir . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell I don't. If I delay this now, after this agreement, it would only further endanger the life of this girl. Does that sound like something you expect me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll accept responsibility for--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You' 11 accept-- Don' t come in here and get noble with me. Responsibility is earned. You can't take something you have no shoulder for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gathers his composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see the note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick produces the note and the blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy and Nick stand with Patrick and Angie going over the RANSOM MAP which is tacked to the wall. Next to it are a geographical survey of the quarry and a street map of the surrounding area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want to separate us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to diverging paths on the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The note instructs you two to wait here on the south side for Amanda and Nick and I to be at the clearing by the edge with the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once Amanda is turned over to you at your position, call us on the radio and we'll turn over the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle, having been observing, interjects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man won't come alone. Who is he likely to bring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris Mullen was in the apartment when we made the offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was probably him that killed Ray for Cheese. If I had to guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't ask you what you guessed.    He asked you what do you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he's a six foot, thirty year old, caucasian heroin addict. And I know it was him, not Cheese, who rolled up Pokey Jackson and shot him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there's that, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy is the voice of reason today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're all set here, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one else knows about this, correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie has a concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wonder.. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to ask: ) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we rationalizing this? I mean, wouldn't a hundred police up there be better for her than the four of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking if keeping this quiet is better for Amanda, or is it better for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle is opaque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any children, Miss Gennaro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you've never lost one. My only child was murdered. She was twelve. You heard about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is rhetorical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you didn't hear, what you don' t know, is what that feels like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are articles on the wall.   COP FATHER OF SLAIN CHI VOWS: NEVER AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I live with? Is knowing my daughter likely died crying out for me to protect her, to come save her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that I never came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She died afraid and alone, in a shallow ditch bank, a few feet from the road and not ten minutes from our house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it is- to lose my child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He now gets more upset than he usually does delivering th speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You force my hand and then question the way I handle to it? Question me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's questioning you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He relaxes a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I honor my daughter with this, this division, so no parent has to live what I've known . . .Not even a woman like Helene McCready .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates photo of Amanda) is all I care about. And we're going to bring her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the sky, lit by the last slivers of light from a set sun, we see the Quincy quarry. It has become, in essence, huge lake, set a hundred or so feet into a rock quarry an surrounded by acres of dense pine. As we travel past the quarry, we see PATRICK'S CAR IN A PARKING LOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car idles. Patrick and Angie sit inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he bringing us all the way up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, big, make sure he can get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All he wants is the money. He just doesn't want to get arrested doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna kill her. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angie, Patrick, Bressant, & Poole follow up a steep i Remy has the BAG OF MONEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This asshole could have picked somewhere on level ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the lights off for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this where all the peak rocks have names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listing the names of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running Tierny, Leo, Dan, Gooch, Jigger, Goreski and runnin' Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd they get those fuckin' names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the kids who died tryin' to jump off em..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More climbing. It starts to get steep. Some stones come l underfoot and trickle downhill. We see that the quarry ro are covered in the graffiti left by previous visitors. They walk in silence.

dialogues.speaker: EXT QUARRY TOP
dialogues.text: They CREST the hill. The city lights are behind them and move to reveal the QUARRY WATER below and the edge before them. The path forks in two, opposite directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Patrick & Angie) This is where we part ways

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divide and conquer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call us on the radio when you have her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bressant cranes his neck. A nervous tick. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, he and Poole turn and head into the darkne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick & Angie are on a steep incline.    The vast o the quarry looms on their right. They climb still higher, finally arriving at 'rooftop.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick looks around. The view is breathtaking, but that isn't it. It doesn't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are they gonna get Amanda to us up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SPLASH IN THE WATER breaks the silence--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNFIRE and TWO MUZZLES FLASH on the opposite side. Staccato voices come across the radio punctuated by gunfi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy, Watch out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I HEARD A SPLASH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Angie take off running toward the gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Angie come flying down the trail, skittering falling. At one point Patrick comes perilously close to t edge but rights himself. Their flashlights come on, bobbi up and down frantically as they make their way back to Po and Bressant at a full on sprint. They can hear Poole and Bressant out loud now, without the walkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOMETHING WENT IN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICKY WATCH OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERE HE GOES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Angie run down the trail and approach a clear POOLE AND BRESSANT are near its edge, chests heaving, and frantically looking down into the quarry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick TRIPS and goes flying, nearly LANDING on CHEESE'S BODY, shot dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did she fall!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick gets up and runs to the quarry edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing I saw was something went in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got one, the other took off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Angie scour the water with their flashlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOMETHING IN THE WATER. A flash of something flesh-colore The minute she sees it, Angie SAILS OUT OVER THE CLIFF AN INTO THE WATER. His flashlight finds ANGIE SWIMMING DETERMINEDLY toward something. He scans and sees what she's after: AMANDA'S D FLOATING IN THE WATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She DIVES beneath the surface . . . And finally emerges near the edge of the lake. She grabs of an outcropping. In her other hand she holds AMANDA'S D MIRABELLE . We move in on Angie, clutching the nightgown and the doll shivering in the frigid, black water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ANGIErS HOSPITAL ROOM - CONTINUOUS Angie is in bed watching a news report, her leg bandaged being slashed open on the rocks. Before Patrick enters we move in a long lens, near macro along Angie, beginning on darkness, then onto her bandage leg, across the arm with an IV in it, stained by iodine a resting on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your leg alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be. You hear anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops found no one up there. Shocker. I guess as soon as they had the money, someone shot Cheese and another guy came out shootin'. They must have tossed her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She saw their faces.      For some people that's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you and me could recognize Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remy said the other two kids were black. So it wasn't Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have they found her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but they got divers up there now, so.. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she could be alive. She could be hiding. She could be stuck . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but, the one cop told me that two years ago some guy killed his wife and dumped her in there-- the divers found the body . . .but it was so dark they lost it and then they could never find it again. There's so many crags and outcroppings and old cars and shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't get your hopes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees she is crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey.   It's okay. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bends over, more emotional pain than physical. She cu her knee up to her chin, holds her abdomen, in obvious pa Patrick climbs into bed with her, wraps her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. . . I'm sorry. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don' t say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We creep back slowly as the news plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . . . every effort to recover her remains so the McCready family can have a proper burial. However this quarry is extremely deep and treacherous. All too often she keeps that which she takes in . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cut back to the Anchor desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, a sad end to that story, Susanne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is, Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron is next with Sports. The Bruins in action tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they are, Phil. The B f s took a crack at the Flyers tonight and the rough stuff started in the first perio--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And like that. She was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. PATRICK   &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick gets a beer out of the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to catch my balance, but the world kept turning forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. PATRICK   &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick in the living room. The only light is the televis ON TV: A MUG SHOT OF CHRIS MULLEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' run lasted a day and a half until, from what they could tell, he ran into someone else who wanted the money even more than he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Dorchester man was gunned down today . . .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the third Dorchester slaying in as many days, 29 year old Chris Mullen was gunned down in an apparent robbery. The Police Commissioner defended the rising tide of crime as a statistical abberation tied to growing umemployment and the humidity of an unusually sweltering summer month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick lies on the couch, heavy. The coffee table is pil high with empty beer cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't turn on the television without another kid gone and feared whatever. Another horror story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missing for four days and Shrewsbury is gripped with fear. After Jimmy Pietro's disappearance, doors are locked and community watch patrols are being formed--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Then we took her.
